snippet: Choosing the right display depends on what it will be used for and the personal tastes of the user.
abstract: Tool Kit column discusses things to consider when buying a computer monitor; points out choosing the right display depends on what it will be used for and the personal tastes of the user.

headline.main: Things to Consider When Buying a Monitor
headline.print_headline: Things to Consider When Buying a Monitor

snippet: The top Republican and Democrat on a House Judiciary subcommittee sent a letter to executives at Universal and two other major labels, asking pointed questions about how the proposed merger would affect competition in the music industry.
abstract: The top Republican and Democrat on a House Judiciary subcommittee sent a letter to executives at Universal and two other major labels, asking pointed questions about how the proposed merger would affect competition in the music industry.

headline.main: House Subcommittee Wades Into the Universal-EMI Deal

snippet: Revenue was down in all major units, but when a write-down is excluded, earnings slightly exceeded analysts’ expectations.
abstract: Hewlett-Packard earnings slightly exceed analysts' expectations; fiscal third-quarter loss was $8.9 billion, or $4.49 a share, compared with profit of $1.9 billion, or 93 cents a share, in the year-ago quarter; revenue was $29.7 billion, down 5 percent from $31.2 bilion.

headline.main: Weak Sales and a Large Write-Down Give H.P. a Loss
headline.print_headline: Weak Sales and a Large Write-Down Give H.P. a Loss

snippet: Foxconn has reduced hours and improved safety in the wake of labor law violations, but more must be done, the auditors said.

headline.main: Work Conditions Said to Improve at Apple Supplier
headline.print_headline: Work Conditions Said to Improve at Apple Supplier

snippet: When Facebook filed for a public offering with the Securities and Exchange Commission, it included a statement about the culture of the company titled "The Hacker Way." But it seems the company isn't sticking to that ethos.
abstract: When Facebook filed for a public offering with the Securities and Exchange Commission, it included a statement about the culture of the company titled "The Hacker Way." But it seems the company isn't sticking to that ethos.

headline.main: Is Facebook Straying From the 'Hacker Way'?

snippet: This summer’s pop hit, Carly Rae Jepsen’s cheerfully flirty “Call Me Maybe,” shows how much the hitmaking machine, and the music industry, have been upended by social media.

headline.main: The New Rise of a Summer Hit: Tweet It Maybe
headline.print_headline: The New Rise of a Summer Hit: Tweet It Maybe

snippet: FreedomPop promises that its Freedom Sleeve for the  iPod  Touch will deliver ''fast and  free Internet  everywhere,'' and that you can ''make phone calls over 4G from your iPod anywhere.''It seems to be a compelling offer, but FreedomPop combines...

snippet: 7:5o p.m. | Updated Add another happy beneficiary of the publishing powerhouse "Fifty Shades of Grey":  Barnes & Noble .Sales of the erotic trilogy, which has dominated paperback and e-book best-seller lists for most of the year, helped lift compa...
abstract: Barnes & Noble reports loss of $41 million, or 78 cents a share, in the quarter ended July 28, compared with a loss of $56.6 million, or 99 cents a share, in the year-ago quarter; revenue rose 2.5 percent to $1.45 billion. (M)4

headline.main: Barnes & Noble Narrows Its Loss as Sales Increase
